items.title: Demon Slayer: Infinity Train – Story and Characters of the Popular Movie!
items.content_html:
The Japanese anime series ‘Kimetsu no Yaiba’, also known as Demon Slayer in the West, has gained incredible worldwide popularity. This is definitely the kind of series that can appeal fans of any age, whether they be adults or children. Fans of the series are already familiar with the great success of the movie ‘Demon Slayer: Infinity Train’, which featured Kyojuro Rengoku, the Demon Slayer Corps Flame Hashira in addition to the main cast! In addition to this, the first part of the second season of the Demon Slayer anime, which recently started in Japan, will be a retelling of the same ‘Mugen Train Arc’ as the movie, with new animations! Fans of this series definitely have a lot to look forward to!

About Demon Slayer’s World of Men and Monsters


The Demon Slayer series begins in in the Taisho era of Japan (1912 – 1926). In the beginning, the protagonist Tanjiro and his family lived a simple life in the wilderness. One day Tanjirou went out to work, and when he returned home, he found that his mother and siblings had been massacred. Tanjiro immediately understood that his family had been attacked by demons, with his sister Nezuko as the only survivor. In order to save Nezuko, Tanjirou hurriedly carried her down the mountain to find help, but when she began to wake up, Tanjiro realized that Nezuko too had become a demon, and their adventures start from there.

The ‘Demon Slayer Corps’ of this universe is, just as its name implies, an organization dedicated to destroying all demons. Those warriors of the Demon Slayer Corps who are able to rise to the highest rank of Hashira are very powerful, but few in number. The Infinity Train of the movie and new season arc is a train that had been the site of many mysterious fatal incidents in the past. The Demon Slayer Corps sent many teams out to eliminate the cause of these incidents, but with no success. It was then decided to send Flame Hashira Kyojuro Rengoku to ensure that the task was completed. Protagonist Tanjiro and his friends from the Demon Slayer Corps are also sent to work together with the Flame Hashira, but no one expected the events that were to come…

Major Characters of the ‘Mugen Train Arc’

Tanjiro Kamado


The eldest son of the Kamado family, and the older brother of Nezuko. He lived a simple life with his family in the mountains. Tanjiro has dark reddish-black hair and red eyes, and his typical gear consists of his haori jacket, which features a square Japanese ‘Ichimatsu’ pattern, and his black sword. In order to find a way to turn his sister back into a human, Tanjiro was introduced into the Demon Slayer Corps by Giyu Tomioka, a the organization’s Water Hashira.

Find Tanjiro Kamado Goods On Buyee

Nezuko Kamado

Tanjiro’s little sister, and the only other survivor of the Kamado family after it was attacked by demons. After becoming a demon herself, Nezuko managed to suppress the demonic urge to attack humans, due to which the members of the Demon Slayer Corps decided to spare her.

Find Nezuko Kamado Goods on Buyee

Zenitsu Agatsuma

A yellow-haired swordsman who joined the Demon Slayer Corps at the same time as the main protagonist Tanjiro, Zenitsu has a very timid personality, but can show amazing strength when he faints/goes to sleep, although it seems that he has no memory of these periods.

Find Zenitsu Agatsuma Goods on Buyee

Inosuke Hashibira

Inosuke is a member of the Demon Slayer Corps like Tanjiro, who wears a wild boar head mask, deer hair around his waist, bear hair around his feet, and is a burly-looking figure who speaks loudly, but hides a beautiful face under his mask.

Find Inosuke Hashibira Goods on Buyee

Kyojuro Rengoku

The Flame Kashira of the Demon Slayer Corps, Kyojuro is a user of the Flame Breathing style. He has a boisterous personality, is capable of excellent leadership and judgment, and acts like a big brother for the other members of the team. In the Demon Slayer: Infinity Train movie, the scene where he endlessly shouts “Delicious!” has become a trending topic among fans.

Find Kyojuro Rengoku Goods on Buyee

Whether you have seen the original Demon Slayer anime series or the Infinity Train movie, now that the Mugen Train Arc is grabbing attention once again, it is a great opportunity to catch up on all of the demon slaying that you have missed! We recommend that you don’t pass this series up if you think that it could be fun for you!

items.title: Puella Magi Madoka Magica’s Story and Characters
items.content_html:
Have you heard of the Japanese ‘magical girl’ genre from anime and manga? Typically, magical girl series star heroines who are still young girls, but through the power of magic, she can power up to fight her enemies. These girls go through many struggles with the hope of eventually ushering in a happier future. However, the anime series ‘Puella Magi Madoka Magica’ which began in January 2011, turned this traditional magical girl story format on its head with its unforgettable setting and characters!

In the world of Madoka Magica, magical girls fight against beings known as ‘witches’. Kyubey, an alien creature, uses the promise of granting any single wish to entice young girls to become magical girls, with the hope that they can defeat witches. They became magical girls, who fight just like traditional magical girls side by side with their companions and defeated many powerful witches. However, there are dark secrets to this power that are revealed during this thrilling series!

The Release History of Madoka Magica

In addition to the memorable main story of Puella Magi Madoka Magica, there have been many side stories shown through comics and additional anime series helping hardcore fans gain a deeper understanding of the greater world of the series. If you are interested in Madoka Magica, we recommend that you finish watching the main anime series first, and then refer to the following info to continue with the most important main spinoffs!

The Magical Girls and Creatures of This Unique World

Madoka Kaname


The main heroine of the story, Madoka was originally an ordinary girl, but was stubbornly pestered by Kyubey to become a magical girl because of her good aptitude. At first, Madoka had an idolized perception of what a magical girl was, but after experiencing various tragedies and learning the truth about the soul gem, she had a different understanding of the magical girl’s contract, and she became timid and hesitant about whether to turn into a magical girl after all.

Find Madoka Kaname Goods on Buyee

Homura Akemi

A magical girl who transferred to Madoka’s class in Episode 1. She repeated puzzling instructions and warnings against Madoka becoming a magical girl. The narrative gradually reveals her secrets and tragic past. Her true identity is that of Madoka’s friend from a different timeline. In order to save Madoka, who has repeatedly died to the strongest witch Walpurgis Night, she has traveled through time many times to try to change the result.

Find Homura Akemi Goods on Buyee

Mami Tomoe


A third grade student of Mitakihara middle school, Madoka’s senior, and a strong magical girl. Fighting based on the belief of protecting others, Mami has a great positive influence on Madoka. In episode 3 of the anime, she dies tragically in front of Madoka and her companions while fighting the witch Charlotte.

Find Mami Tomoe Goods on Buyee

Sayaka Miki

Madoka’s classmate and friend, who becomes a magical girl. After accepting the contract, Sayaka felt that she was no longer a human being. She later accumulates a lot of negative emotions from a love triangle that she gets caught up in, which causes her Soul Gem to quickly turn into a Grief Seed, turning her into a witch.

Find Sayaka Miki Goods on Buyee

Kyubey


A cat-like animal that claims to be a magical messenger. In reality, it is a member of an alien race.. By fulfilling any wish of girls at the price of extracting their souls to make gems, Kyubey’s task is to urge the girls to sign a contract to become a magical girl. After its true purpose of using the girls as a consumable resource for squeezing out energy in order to extend the life of the universe is revealed, Kyubey argued that it is a reasonable judgment to sacrifice magical girls for the survival of the universe.

Find Kyubey Goods on Buyee

Kyoko Sakura

After Mami’s death, Kyoko set off to meet the magical girls in Mitakihara. Sayaka, who became a magical girl by making a wish for others in a similar way to Kyoko, is someone who she both clashes with but finds common ground with at the same time. The two are similar in nature, so Kyoko tries to gradually guide Sayaka and give her useful advice.

Find Kyoko Sakura Goods on Buyee

The animation of the Magic Girl Madoka Magica may seem very kid-friendly at first, but is probably more suitable for adults to watch. If parents plan to let their children watch this series, we would say to please do so with some caution!

items.title: Get Exercising with Nintendo Switch! 5 Trending Japanese Indoor Exercise Games
items.content_html:
When doing exercises to achieve long-term weight loss, in addition to the time required to see any benefits, a certain degree of endurance is also required. This endurance requires strong motivation, and video games on systems such as the Nintendo Switch have been shown to provide the best kind of motivation for anyone who wants to achieve weight loss, which is to play while exercising!

The 5 games we will present in this article are all ones that have been recognized by the gaming public as providing great slimming benefits after regular use. They can cause you to happily tackle the game’s challenges while unknowingly breaking a heavy sweat, helping you to acquire the benefits of aerobic exercise and weight loss. If you are interested, we hope you will take a look!

Ring Fit Adventure

Ring Fit Adventure is a fitness game developed by Nintendo for the Nintendo Switch. The Ring-Con accessory introduced with the game is made of polyester fiber and nylon and has great elastic strength. There are sensors in the ring that can sense the player’s movements. The player needs to detach the Switch’s Joy-Con controllers and insert them into the Ring-Con and the Leg Strap, respectively. The game is turn-based according to different movements that the player must perform. It has an RPG adventure game where you only need to use Ring-Con and Leg Strap to match the actions in the game in order to defeat monsters and beat levels. The game also includes fitness-specific mini-games and fitness exercises and other modes for players to choose.

Find Ring Fit Adventure on Yahoo! JAPAN Shopping

Fit Boxing 2: Rhythm & Exercise

In this game, the player holds the Joy-Con controllers and follows the in-game instructions to simulate boxing in accordance with the rhythm, while at the same time enduring fun physical training. If you play this boxing game often, maybe you too could become a boxing pro!

Find Fit Boxing 2 on Yahoo! JAPAN Shopping

Zumba Burn it Up!

Zumba is an international lifestyle program that mixes fitness, entertainment, culture and various other elements. This series of games can be your perfect introduction to Zumba! Rhythms from all over the world are added to the game. Players can simply go along with the rhythm to exercise, making you feel like you are truly having a party.

Find Zumba Burn it Up! on Yahoo! JAPAN Shopping

FiNC HOME FiT

Based on martial arts such as boxing, karate, Muay Thai, and Kung Fu, FiNC HOME FiT has developed aerobic exercises that burn fat efficiently and exercise the muscle groups of the entire body. Includes fitness games where you build up your strength simply by matching your movements to the rhythm.

Find FiNC HOME FiT on Yahoo! JAPAN Shopping

Just Dance 2021

Just Dance 2021 is the ultimate dance game, featuring 40 new top singles on the charts. You can start a rocking party with your family and friends and dance the day away!

Find Just Dance 2021 on Yahoo! JAPAN Shopping

These games are the perfect fit for those who like to exercise indoors, or who want to lose weight while saving time! Remember everyone – if you are looking for convenient exercise in busy situations, the Nintendo Switch may your best place to play!

items.title: The Best and Weirdest Video Games in Japan – 2020 Edition!
items.content_html:
As the holiday season begins and people begin to consider what the best gift would be to get for friends and family, video games are always a popular choice! If you are leaning toward getting a fun piece of software for someone you know, why not give this article a look? We have included a list of games that enjoyed great success with Japanese audiences this year! In addition, we have featured some of what we are calling the ‘weirdest games in Japan’, that capture the unique spirit that can make big cult classics out of so many of Japan’s games! Give that special someone a taste of games that have become ‘Big in Japan’!

The Top 5 Hit Japanese Games of 2020

Here is a list of the 5 games that we felt made the biggest impact in Japan during 2020. Although 2020 has been an unpredictable year thus far, the popularity of these games is strong enough to overcome this feeling, or even become popular due to how their playstyle matches the current environment!

Animal Crossing: New Horizons (Nintendo Switch)

Although the Animal Crossing series has been popular worldwide since it began nearly 20 years ago, this newest entry has reached an unprecedented level of success! It is said that its open, independent game design that has the player build a home and friendships in a virtual world has been especially popular with people wishing to escape the frustrations of the current year. Its online mode also provides a way to socialize with other fans regardless of the real world situation!

Find on Yahoo! JAPAN Shopping

This is a unique kind of exercise-role-playing game that uses its packed-in physical attachments (the Ring-Con and Leg Strap) to enable easy exercise at home while enjoying light story and action gameplay. Frequent lockdowns that caused many exercise facilities and gyms to close in 2020 have led to an incredible surge in demand for this game, making it one of the most popular games on the Switch.

Find on Yahoo! JAPAN Shopping

Ring Fit Adventure (Nintendo Switch)

Fortnite (2017 – Various Platforms)

Fortnite has been released on many platforms, from handhelds to home consoles to mobile phones, since its successful launch in 2017. Its Battle Royale mode in particular has gained an enthusiastic worldwide fanbase, and Japan is no different! You can find many popular Japanese gaming personalities who dedicate much of their time to Fortnite matches!

Find on Yahoo! JAPAN Shopping

Soccer is a very popular sport in Japan, and while this has led to multiple successful locally-made franchises such as the Inazuma Eleven games or Konami’s Pro Evolution Soccer series, FIFA still has many fans. The gameplay is easy to get into casually and hard to master, making it an addictively fun experience that boasts a huge worldwide fanbase, even during the uncertainty of 2020.

Find on Yahoo! JAPAN Shopping

FIFA 21 (2020 – Various Platforms)

Final Fantasy VII Remake (PS4)

A remake of the 1997 classic, this long-in-development PS4 exclusive managed to exceed expectations to build its own separate identity and become a hit in its own right! It has found many fans in Japan who still have fond memories of the original version.

Find on Yahoo! JAPAN Shopping

5 Weird Japanese Video Games!

For those who wish to find something a bit out of the ordinary for this holiday season, please give this next list a look! These ‘weird’ Japanese games are not all necessarily from this year, but their unique qualities have a life long beyond their time on store shelves! They would be perfect for that person in your life who wants to try a game that would give a very new kind of experience!

Sakuna: Of Rice and Ruin (2020 – Nintendo Switch, PS4, PC)

This recent Japanese release may have gained notice from its pleasing combination of farming-simulation and action game genres, but its intense focus on an extremely detailed depiction of rice cultivation, which took 5 years to develop, is what gives it that uniquely Japanese quality. The kind of game that will remain a topic of conversation for years to come!

Find on Yahoo! JAPAN Shopping

This experimental game for the original Playstation comes from creator Osamu Sato, who saw his games as a way of exhibiting art. LSD is based on a years-long dream diary of an employee at its developer, and its surreal design has become a topic of conversation in recent years among online Japanese game enthusiast communities.

Find on Yahoo! JAPAN Auction

LSD: Dream Emulator (1998 – PS1)

Mister Mosquito (2001 – PS2)

Just from the Japanese cover which you can see to the left, you can tell that Mister Mosquito (Known as Ka in Japan, or just ‘Mosquito’) may be the perfect game for this list! In fact, Eidos Interactive, which published it outside of Japan, specifically stated that they were attracted to its ‘odd’ and ‘quirky’ qualities that are normally not available in games outside of Japan! Perhaps too strange for audiences outside of Japan, its 2004 sequel ended up only being released in Japan. However, dedicated fans held out hope that Sony would eventually localize it at the time.

Find on Yahoo! JAPAN Shopping

This Japanese video game is legendary for its uniqueness in design. Players raise a fish with a human face in one of the oddest experiences to ever be made for a major home console! It even makes use of the Dreamcast microphone attachment to achieve its strange goals, allowing you to have limited conversations with the creature as it grows to adulthood. Truly a game like none other!

Find on Yahoo! JAPAN Auction

Seaman (2001 – Sega Dreamcast)

Kuma Uta (2003 – PS2)

When it comes to notable ‘cult’ Japanese games for the Playstation 2, Kuma Uta (Bear Song) is among the strangest! This game stars a polar bear who gets into enka, a traditional Japanese genre of singing. The bear will ask questions, and you answers will inform the custom lyrics of the songs that it sings in the game!

Find on Yahoo! JAPAN Auction

Buying Japanese Video Games Online

Have you gotten more interested in looking for Japanese video games to build up your collection or give to others during the holidays? If so, we recommend using the many stores on Buyee as a way to get normally Japan-exclusive games delivered to your door through the power of proxy shipping!

See More on Buyee

Mister Mosquito (2001 – PS2)









Just from the Japanese cover which you can see to the left, you can tell that Mister Mosquito (Known as Ka in Japan, or just ‘Mosquito’) may be the perfect game for this list! In fact, Eidos Interactive, which published it outside of Japan, specifically stated that they were attracted to its ‘odd’ and ‘quirky’ qualities that are normally not available in games outside of Japan! Perhaps too strange for audiences outside of Japan, its 2004 sequel ended up only being released in Japan. However, dedicated fans held out hope that Sony would eventually localize it at the time.

When it comes to notable ‘cult’ Japanese games for the Playstation 2, Kuma Uta (Bear Song) is among the strangest! This game stars a polar bear who gets into enka, a traditional Japanese genre of singing.
